title: Eating out with mum
text:
Home » travel » Eating out with mum AROUND THAILAND THE NATION August 5, 2015 1:00 am 
Eating out with mum at Sofitel Bangkok Sukhumvit Signature dishes include pan-fried foie gras, slow roasted leg of lamb stuffed with wild mushrooms, flavourful green curry with fish balls ... Eating out with mum Sofitel Bangkok Sukhumvit makes Mother's Day extra special with a free buffet brunch for mum at Voila restaurant. The offer applies to two or more people plus mother and the brunch is priced at Bt2,200 a head. Signature dishes include pan-fried foie gras, slow roasted leg of lamb stuffed with wild mushrooms, flavourful green curry with fish balls, red curry with roasted duck and desserts galore. Book a table at (02) 126 9999. Flying high to HO CHI MINH Nok Air, Thailand's low-cost carrier, is introducing its Bangkok-Ho Chi Minh City route with effect from October 1. Flight reservations are now being accepted through Nok Air's website, www.NokAir.com, through the Call Centre at 1318 and at Nok Air ticket booths at airports. The all-inclusive promotion starts from Bt1,490 per person per flight. Promotion seats are limited on each flight and may not be available on some flights. Enchanting escape Families can stay in style at Escape Khao Yai Hotel's new two-bedroom villa. Known as the "Grand Two-Bedroom Sunken Heated Pool Villa", the spacious accommodation is designed for large families or groups of friends wanting to experience the beautiful countryside of Nakhon Ratchasima Province. The villa features a roomy pantry and living room and boasts a soothing fragrance and thematic music selection. The private outdoor Sunken Heated Pool is ideal for relaxation and enjoying Khao Yai's mountain views. The villa can accommodate a maximum of five guests with the option of extra beds. Escape Khao Yai Hotel is a member of Sansiri Hotel Collection. A very welcome arrival Thailand reached 17 million foreign visitors last week with the arrival of Omani Yaqdhan Hamad Khalifa at Suvarnabhumi Airport. Khalifa, who was travelling with his wife and child, participated in the brief celebration inside the arrival hall, which was attended by well wishers from Tourism Authority of Thailand, Thai Airways, Airport Authority of Thailand and True Corporation. The lucky Omani takes home two return air tickets on the Bangkok-Muscat route, five nights accommodation and a SIM card for local calls. 273 Viewed
